item.title: [PI] Afk command
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Declare sit as an = false;

if (playerCommand.startsWith("afk") && c.sit == false) { if(c.inWild()) { c.sendMessage("Er, it's not to smart to go AFK in the Wilderness..."); return; } c.sit = true; if(c.playerRights == 0) { c.startAnimation(4117); c.forcedText = "I'm now going AFK (away from keyboard)"; c.forcedChatUpdateRequired = true; c.updateRequired = true; c.sendMessage("When you return type ::back, you cannot move while AFK is on."); }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Afk command
item.dc:creator: @teh_one teh one
item.description:
@teh_one wrote:

Uhm, so you want to make the player static, correct?

As far as i know, there’s not a method that i know of in PI that can switch your player from static to moveable. IF there is, then i’m sorry :S. Either way, no one is going to soonfeed this command to you, look for some tutorials, maybe under a jail command or something simular.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Afk command
item.dc:creator: @codeman9909 codeman9909
item.description:
@codeman9909 wrote:

  1. How do I make an afk command where when you are afk you can’t move.

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“afk”) && !c.sit) {
if(c.inWild()) {
c.sendMessage(“Er, it’s not to smart to go AFK in the Wilderness…”);
return;
}
c.sit = true;
c.startAnimation(4117);
c.forcedText = “Im afk!”;
c.forcedChatUpdateRequired = true;
c.updateRequired = true;
c.sendMessage(“When you return type ::back, you cannot move while AFK is on.”);
}

Read full topic
